intro: Anoplophytum strictum, commonly known as the rigid spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Anoplophytum strictum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
